reviewText: Jefferson Moore told me that this was his favorite movie that he's brought to life. He played a character other than Jesus in this one. In fact, his character was a long way from that of Jesus, except for the long hair. Moore got a chance to show off the range of his acting skill with this one as he had the opportunity to get mad, sad, frustrated, and grief stricken. He passed all the litmus tests in my book. The story involved a lot of pathos. Most of the characters were void of Christian character, except for the little girl, played wonderfully by Christina Dawn Fougnie. Clancy was not so much a bad guy, but he wasn't a model citizen either. As the protagonist, his character arc was steeply upward. Despite the gloom all around her, the little girl with her big faith changed the world around her, instead of vice versa. Look out, Pollyanna, you have some competition. This one is well worth watching.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Jefferson Moore stars as a war veteran with some PTSD issues but still, rightly trusted to look after a young girl (Christina Dawn Fougnie) when the local small time politicians see an opportunity to look like heroes for the upcoming election.The plot from the politicians leaves Moore and Fougnie with no option but to travel one step ahead of a misinformed law and media and the bond of friendship and message of faith, fellowship and trust builds a bridge we can all cross and sometimes need to.Worthington and crew have given us a great little story to show true values and benefits. The themes of honesty, friendship, faith and trust as well as loyalty and dangers of going the other way are well told and beautifully presented.
summary: Politics and Policing Place People in Problems

reviewText: I love anything by Jefferson Moore.  God truly works through Jefferson's movies.  This is an incredible movie.  It is definitely not a light-hearted movie.  Only watch if you are ready for something deep and meaningful.  It is a tearjerker.  My 10-year old hated it because of the tearjerker qualities.  My 6 year old has watched it repeatedly.  I am so thankful there is a movie out there like this that my 6 year old wants to watch repeatedly.  Great message.
summary: Jefferson is does awesome work again

reviewText: "...even though "Clancy" falls into the typical overacted, overscored, and awkwardly humored faith-based movie genre, there's still a decent enough story here to entertain at least a few folks. Oh, and did I mention it's got a very unexpected ending?" -Lance; Cruciflicks Co-Founder"There's a quote from the movie that stood out to me, and I guess it sort of sums up the message the writer was trying to convey: "If you know you're going to Heaven, then dying isn't something you have to worry about. If you don't have to worry about dying, then how can you worry about anything else?"" -Mary; Cruciflicks Co-FounderFor the rest of our reviews on this and other faith based films, check out cruciflicks.net where "We don't judge people, just the movies they make."

reviewText: Once again, the versatile Jefferson Moore (THE PERFECT STRANGER) has blessed us with another enlightening vision.A scarred and faithless man (MOORE) finds redemption through the heart of a little girl (a mesmerizing performance by CHRISTINA FOUGNIE).They both travel on rocky avenues of escape until their lives intertwine and enable each to find comfort and peace that neither could have previously achieved.Being an author of Christian novels myself, I truly appreciate a film that not only touches my heart, but elevates my soul with its message.CLANCY will enrich your lives.

reviewText: I love this movie. It really presents the gospel in a clear manner. It is full of funny and poignant scenes. It is too intense for young children but great for jr. High and above. What I really love about it is that the storyline is real and the script is right on target for the subject matter. Christina is very good in this. KUDOS to her!

reviewerName: Penny Zeller, Christian Author and Speaker
reviewText: Clancy is easily one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. While it is not for children due to the nature of the film, it is an excellent show for teens and older. Despite being abused, Clancy holds strong to her faith in the Lord and shares it with Nick, a homeless man that has agreed to take care of her after she runs away. The acting is superb and the characters realistic. Spoiler warning: it does have a sad ending. I advise watching the "alternate ending" as I believe it should have been the real ending. I would highly recommend this film. I have added it to my Mom-Approved movie listing on my Wordpress blog.
summary: One of the best movies I've seen in a long time...
